txt.en: 'Morcar is a stubborn one, but perhaps we should leave. The Whitshaws has never been so cold, nor so deadly.\n\n'I do not fancy the thought of wasting our catch, though. 'Twould be a favour if ye check the nets we have along the bank.'
The man nods his gratitude and takes the fish you pulled in from the shore.\n\n'Aye, this will do. Now we shall have food for our packs, if we can get Morcar to heed yer advice.'
Today's fishing catch should be drawn in and packed so that the fishermen may swiftly evacuate to Forlaw.
Bring the fish to the fishermen

The fish of today's catch can be found in nets along the northern edge of the Isingmere in the Whitshaws, near the fishermen's encampment.\n\nYou should draw in the nets to gather fish for the two men's journey to Forlaw, for they will need fuel for their trek.

The fish of today's catch can be found in nets along the northern edge of the Isingmere in the Whitshaws, near the fishermen's encampment.\n\nYou should draw in the nets to gather fish for the two men's journey to Forlaw, for they will need fuel for their trek.

The fishermen can be found at the north-eastern edge of the Whitshaws on the edge of the Isingmere.\n\nYou should bring the fish to the fishermen so that they will have food for their journey to Forlaw.
The man nods his gratitude and takes the fish you pulled in from the shore.\n\nNow the two men will have food for their packs if they decide to abide the summons and retreat to Forlaw.
